message.content:
cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.NE 

This paper deals with control theory and learning the region of attraction for nonlinear systems. The most relevant sub-category is cs.SY (Systems and Control), which deals with the analysis and design of control systems. The use of Gaussian processes for modeling the system errors suggests a connection to machine learning, specifically in the area of probabilistic modeling, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves active exploration of the state space, which is a common problem in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of Lyapunov functions is a common tool in robotics and optimization, which fall under cs.RO (Robotics) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), respectively.
